goals.goal: it would mean waking up feeling more refreshed i think turn off screens at 11 and be in bed by 11:30 . i think 3 days is realistic for me two weeks seems good
Walking around my neighborhood sounds good 30 min sounds doable 2x a week im thinking friday and saturday

metadata.tracking_method: no i like that one as is

chat_history.content: [START_SESSION]

Hello Jade, it's wonderful to see you again for our final session together. I'm really looking forward to hearing how things went with your sleep routine and neighborhood walks over the past week.

How did it go with turning off screens at 11 and getting to bed by 11:30 on those three nights you planned?
it went well

That's great to hear! I'm glad it went well for you.

Can you tell me a bit more about what worked well with your sleep routine this week?
i had time so i was able to work on my goals

I'm so glad you had the time to focus on your goals. That's really wonderful.

And how about your neighborhood walks - were you able to get out for those 30-minute walks on Friday and Saturday like you planned?
yup

That's fantastic, Jade! You accomplished both of your goals this week - the sleep routine and the walks. That's something to really celebrate.

What happened that made it possible for you to follow through on both goals this week?
i just had more time because my schooling is coming to the end

That makes sense - having more time as the semester winds down really helped you prioritize these goals.

On a scale of 1 to 10, what was your stress level like this past week?

A 3 is pretty manageable, and it sounds like having that extra time made a real difference in keeping your stress lower.

Now that you've successfully done both goals this week, what did you notice about how they affected you - like your energy, mood, or how you felt overall?
i felt great recently

That's wonderful to hear, Jade. It sounds like the combination of better sleep and those walks really made a positive difference for you.

So looking ahead, what's the focus for today - would you like to work on your current goals, maybe adjust them, or set some completely new ones?
i want to work on my current goals

Great, let's look at your current goals then.

Is there anything that needs to change with either your sleep goal - turning off screens at 11 and being in bed by 11:30 three days a week - or your walking goal - 30 minutes twice a week on Friday and Saturday - to help you be successful moving forward on your own after our program ends?
i want to increase my sleep goal to 4 days a week

That sounds like a great next step, especially since you've been feeling so great with the three days.

So your updated sleep goal would be turning off screens at 11 and being in bed by 11:30 four days a week - which four days are you thinking would work best for you?
i think m-th

Perfect, so Monday through Thursday for your screen and sleep routine. That gives you a nice consistent weekday structure.

On a scale of 1 to 10, how confident do you feel about hitting this goal of turning off screens at 11 and being in bed by 11:30 Monday through Thursday over the next week?

That's wonderful confidence, and it makes sense given how well things have been going for you.

How will you remember to work on this goal each night - what kind of reminder or system will help you stick to it on your own?
ill set a reminder on my phone

That's a solid plan - a phone reminder can be really effective for building that evening routine.

What about your walking goal - do you want to keep that at 30 minutes twice a week on Fridays and Saturdays, or would you like to adjust that one too?
no i like that one as is

Great, so we'll keep the walking at 30 minutes on Fridays and Saturdays.

Since this is our last session together, I'm curious - how will you keep these goals going after our sessions end, and what's your plan for staying on track long-term?
ill keep the alarms on my phone

Phone alarms are a great tool to keep you on track with the daily reminders.

Beyond the alarms, what will you do if you hit a rough patch or find yourself slipping on these goals - do you have anyone in your life who could support you or help keep you accountable?
yeah i can get my boyfriend to support me

That's wonderful - having your boyfriend's support can make a real difference when things get tough.

Do you have any final questions or anything else you'd like to discuss before we wrap up today?
no

It's been such a pleasure working with you over these four sessions, Jade. You've made real progress - from feeling overwhelmed at a stress level of 8 to where you are now at 3, and you've built some solid habits around sleep and movement. I'm confident you have the tools and support to keep moving forward. Best of luck with everything, and take care of yourself.
bye
Bye, Jade. Take care!
